# <img src="https://i.imgur.com/m8FNhQR.png" align="right" height=88 /> fgeo.data

[![lifecycle](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/fgeo.data)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=fgeo.data)
[![Travis build status](https://travis-ci.org/forestgeo/fgeo.data.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/forestgeo/fgeo.data)

__fgeo.data__ provides open datasets of ForestGEO.

## [See datasets](https://forestgeo.github.io/fgeo.data/articles/fgeo.data.html)

## Installation

```
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("forestgeo/fgeo.data")
```

For details on how to install packages from GitHub, see [this article](https://goo.gl/dQKEeg).

## Example

(See columns definitions with `?data_dictionary`.)

```{r}
library(fgeo.data)
```

### ViewFullTable (`vft`)

```{r}
vft <- luquillo_vft_4quad

# Show first few columns to save space.
str(vft, give.attr = FALSE, list.len = 5)

lapply(vft, function(x) head(unique(x)))
```
